data.title: 3D messages ingame
data.body:
We need support for displaying any text in the game.

This allows us to e.g. display debug messages for current coordinates of objects which would otherwise spam the console.

The first step would be creating a new logging function, which gets the display coordinates as first input.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/5619827-3d-messages-ingame?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F371436&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F371436&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Add build prerequisite steps for openSUSE.
data.body:
Confirmed proper packages by using Dockefile to build from base opensuse.

``` Dockerfile
FROM boombatower/opensuse

RUN zypper addrepo --no-gpgcheck \
      http://download.opensuse.org/repositories/devel:languages:python3/openSUSE_13.1/devel:languages:python3.repo && \
    zypper addrepo --no-gpgcheck \
      http://packman.inode.at/suse/openSUSE_13.1/ packman && \
    zypper refresh

RUN zypper --non-interactive install --no-recommends \
  cmake \
  fontconfig-devel \
  ftgl-devel \
  gcc-c++ \
  glew-devel \
  libfreetype6 \
  libogg-devel \
  libopus-devel \
  libSDL2-devel \
  libSDL2_image-devel \
  opusfile-devel \
  opus-tools \
  python3-devel \
  python3-numpy \
  python3-Pillow

ADD . /srv/openage
WORKDIR /srv/openage

RUN ./configure --mode=release --prefix=/usr && \
    make
```

data.title: Update requirement text to include AoE II: HD for asset conversion.
data.body: Followup on #10.

data.title: Screenshot storage and numbering
data.body:
Currently, each screenshot is put to `/tmp/openage_00.png`.
This should be updated to `~/.openage/screenshots/openage_xxxx.png`, where `xxxx` is incremented automatically (start counting at `0`!).

For debugging purposes, the game version described in #27 should be included on the screenshots when it's not disabled by the user.

data.title: Fix format specifiers for long longs
data.body: This removes some warnings when compiling with `clang` on OS X 10.10.

data.title: Can not flattr
data.body:
Hi,

when trying to flattr this really nice project via the button in the readme I get:

```
Sorry, content not supported
Unfortunately we can't support flattring this content. We couldn't find an owner for it and thus can't flattr it - sorry for that.

If you think we should've been able to find an owner, then contact our support. If you want to find something else to flattr, then visit our catalog.
```

Maybe a problem with the button, maybe something temporary - just wanted to let you know :)

Best regards
Niklas

data.title: Fix inclusion of pty.h header
data.body: On OS X this is part of util.h.

data.title: Find another solution to find python in cmake
data.body:
Finding Python with cmake will not work on OS X if python3 is installed via [homebrew](brew.sh).
See [the cmake issue](http://www.itk.org/Bug/view.php?id=14810), [the homebrew issue](https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew/issues/25118) and #16 . There has not been any activity regarding the cmake issue since April.
An alternative solution is this [cmake module](https://github.com/qgis/QGIS/blob/master/cmake/FindPythonLibrary.cmake). It's licensed under BSD. Details regarding licensing can be found [here](https://github.com/qgis/QGIS/blob/master/cmake/COPYING-CMAKE-SCRIPTS).
For a temporary fix when using homebrewed python3, use the following to configure the project *you might need to adjust the version):

``` bash
  --raw-cmake-args \
  -DPYTHON_INCLUDE_DIR=/usr/local/Cellar/python3/3.4.2_1/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.4/include/python3.4m/ \
  -DPYTHON_LIBRARY=/usr/local/Cellar/python3/3.4.2_1/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.4/lib/libpython3.4.dylib \
  -DPython_FRAMEWORKS=/usr/local/Cellar/python3/3.4.2_1/Frameworks/Python.framework
```

data.title: Include termios.h instead of the termio.h
data.body:
Termio is specific for System III and System V machines and not part of
the POSIX standard ([see this Wikipedia article](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/POSIX_terminal_interface#The_termios_data_structure)).

data.title: FONTCONFIG_LIBS configuration missing (Fedora)
data.body: I got an issue trying to install it on fedora. I replace each debian package described in the installation instructions to the packages found in fedora repository (which the command would be `sudo yum install cmake python3-devel SDL2-devel ftgl-devel SDL2_image-devel opus-tools glew-devel freeglut-devel libpng-devel freetype-devel opusfile-devel mingw32-fontconfig`, after it is working we can even add in the documentation). The problem is with the `FONTCONFIG_LIBS` variable (the output message claims, the whole output is [here](https://gist.github.com/luan-cestari/b1a20dddf00865e445cd)), which I think it would need to be defined but I don't know to where exactly, any guess? Thank you guys in advance

data.title: Fix SDL2_image include directory hints for OS X systems
data.body: Added some hints where to find SDL2_image include headers on OS X.

data.title: Refactored the Opusfile cmake rules into own module
data.body: To properly find Opusfile on OS X (and possibly other systems too) a hint had to be added to find the include directory of Opusfile. To keep the CMakeLists.txt file clean, a new cmake module was created for finding the Opusfile include directories and libraries.

data.title: Render manager

milestone.title: Architecture restructuring
milestone.description: New engine architecture is in place

data.body:
The rendermanager is some kind of batching mechanism to optimize the opengl calls.
This mainly means to reduce the amount of texture and shader switches for now.

Everything that should be rendered is submitted to the render manager. It orders the jobs and finally draws them in the optimized, but correct order.

data.title: Rendering of buildings broken under r300g/Mobility FireGL V5250 (poor driver/hardware support?)
data.body:
Buildings simply do not render under r300g (on a Mobility FireGL V5250, like Radeon X1700) : http://plantmonster.net/~oldlaptop/images/openage-blackbuilding.png

The following fragment of console log seems relevant:

```
r300 FP: Compiler Error:
../../../../../../src/gallium/drivers/r300/compiler/r500_fragprog_emit.c::emit_paired():  emit_alu: Too many instructions
Using a dummy shader instead.
```

Whether this can or should be fixed on openage's end, I don't know. Perhaps it's even a hardware limitation.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/5566202-rendering-of-buildings-broken-under-r300g-mobility-firegl-v5250-poor-driver-hardware-support?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F371436&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F371436&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Fixed a llvm compiler issue - ambiguous call to abs
data.body:
Had to recreate the pull request to remove the redundant commit.

Also updated to use cost_t instead of float.

data.title: Small change required for compilation on llvm
data.body:
Got an ambiguous call to abs when compiling with Xcode - corrected this by forcing the type to float (abs either takes double or float)

Somehow messed up the push so there are 2 commits for the same change!

data.title: Invoke conversion script from the game binary
data.body:
The `openage.convert` script should be invoked by the game.

The game launches its own Python interpreter to perform the conversion.
The input path could be queried interactively someday,
the output path equals the _userassets_ directory which will be `~/.openage/` later.
- Create `openage --convert` invokation
- Load python interpreter in the game (`cpp/python.cpp`)
- Modify `sys.path`
- `AGE2DIR`  equals the argument to `--convert`
- Invoke `openage.convert.__main__.main()`

data.title: create nyan - yet another notation
data.body:
_nyan_ is the future data storage format for openage.

It's designed for moddability and human-readability.

Development takes place here:
https://github.com/SFTtech/nyan

Tasks:
- [x] format specification
- [x] implement the [nyan database](https://github.com/SFTtech/nyan)

data.title: render the game version on screen
data.body:
If people create screenshots which should illustrate positioning, rendering, etc.. problems, it'll be easier to debug if the used gameversion is directly visible.

The game version could be displayed in the lower left corner. Toggling its display with e.g. F3 might be helpful (like minecraft did it).

data.title: Build system uses nonexistent python 3.3 headers
data.body: On Debian testing (with python3.3 and 3.4 interpereters installed, but _only_ python3.4 headers), the build system attempts to use 3.3 headers that do not exist. Inspection of the CMake cache suggests it's attempting to use the 3.3 interpreter with the 3.4 headers; `PYTHON_EXECUTABLE` is `/usr/bin/python3.3`, while `PYTHON_INCLUDE_DIR` is `/usr/include/python3.4m`. The compiler is finally invoked with `-I /usr/include/python3.3m`, however.

data.title: convert: HD support (re: #10) (the real thing)
data.body:
/me learns

This PR makes the convert script work with HD Edition's resources, so people don't necessarily have to have the CD version, but can also get HD Edition from Steam and use that.

It relies on some obsolete files that still ship with HD Edition, so it may break in the future, if they clean up their builds.

Tested with a new HD Edition installation as of october 27, 2014.
